column4: I am getting a very unusual problem,have apache2 running and php4 also installed,but when i am trying to run a php file with phpinfo() it fails to run, any pointers?
is php configured properly?
I didnt get you? what all the things/files I need check?
well apache/php4 have to be configured correctly, it just doesnt work out of the box
any site/link?
been awhile since i ran apache/php but i think /etc/php4/ should have a config file, read through it, and do the same with /etc/apache/ there should be a config file in there aswell
lemme find a good apache/php4 howto for you
ok I am looking in it
thanks
oh, did you restart apache yet?
: yep
and it wont open via http://www.blah.com/blah.php?
: nope, it opens save as dialog!
k, seems like this thread is about the same problem your having....http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=79106&highlight=apache
ill keep looking
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=41687
: thanks, I am looking in them
: its solved now :)
good :P
: it seems I had both apache and apache2 and php-mod-apache was having problem for apache2
you had both apache and apache2 installed?
: yes, I upgraded yesterday using apt-get
